top_categories.workout_context: CIRREM rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
CIRREM’s illinois farmland, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing CIRREM isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
CIRREM’s illinois rolling farmland gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of CIRREM. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at CIRREM when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
CIRREM’s illinois rolling farmland gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at CIRREM — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for CIRREM — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Every session at CIRREM intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what CIRREM’s illinois rolling farmland gravel delivers on race day.
The varied gradients at CIRREM reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for CIRREM’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at CIRREM requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on illinois rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: illinois farmland, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 75 miles of illinois rolling farmland gravel in Roubaix, Illinois.
